You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENHANCE YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH SALESFORCE FEEDBACK MANAGEMENT
Create a Basic Survey

Create a basic survey that you can use to embed in a custom app or on an external website.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: both Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Available with the Feedback Management - Starter and Feedback Management - Growth licenses


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a basic survey:	

Permissions to create surveys

Keep in mind these limitations about basic surveys.

You can only add like or dislike, long text, multiple selection, NPS, rating, short text, and single selection questions.
You can’t use display logic to show questions based on responses to other questions on the page.
From the App Launcher, find and select Surveys.
Click New.
Enter a name for the survey and then select Basic Survey.
To use the survey as a template, select Create survey as a template.
Survey templates are automatically shared with Read access for all users in your Salesforce org.
To add a question to the page, click Add Question.
To reorder questions on a survey page, click  above the rich text editor of the questions.
To change the question’s properties, click .
Edit the survey’s Thank You page.
To pause working on the survey and continue working on it later, click Save.
To see how the survey looks while you're working on it, click Preview.
To activate the survey so that you can send it, click Activate.

Now that you've created a basic survey, you can embed it on a custom app or publish it on an external website by using the Survey Response Connect API.

IMPORTANT Only basic surveys support the Survey Response Connect API.
SEE ALSO
Connect REST API Developer Guide: Survey Invitations Using Invitation Configurations (POST, PATCH)
Connect REST API Developer Guide: Surveys Invitations Using Invitation ID (POST, PATCH)
